p: The antimicrobial activity assay from both root and leaf extracts demonstrates antibacterial and antifungal activities against the isolate of Bacillus subtilis (Gram positive), Escherichia coli, Klebsiella pneumoniae, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Staphylococcus aureus, Salmonella typhi (Gram negative), and fungal strain, i.e., Aspergillus niger, Candida albicans, Penicillium notatum, and Rhizopus stolon [ 61]. The essential oil of Ageratum conyzoides L. leaves has antibacterial activity in inhibiting Salmonella enteritidis [ 62]. The leaves and stem extract of Ageratum conyzoides L. can be used as a broad-spectrum antibacterial agent. Moreover, the in vitro study from the methanolic extract and n-hexane extract of Ageratum conyzoides L. showed antifungal activities against Fusarium solani [ 63]. The leaves and stem extracts of Ageratum conyzoides L. contain phytochemical substances such as flavonoid, saponin, alkaloid, tannin, and phenol, which showed antibacterial activity depends on its concentration against the bacterial isolate [ 64].
